features: Unified API for multiple AI providers
default.heading: Welcome to One API

channels.description: Configure and manage API routing channels

knowledge.help: Knowledge base identifier for AI Proxy knowledge retrieval.
knowledge.label: Knowledge ID

ak.help: AWS Access Key ID with permissions to call Bedrock.
ak.label: Access Key *

aws.heading: AWS Bedrock Configuration
aws.note: The final API key will be constructed as: AK|SK|Region

region.help: AWS region for Bedrock (e.g., us-east-1). Must match where your models/profiles reside.
region.label: Region *

sk.help: AWS Secret Access Key for the above Access Key ID.
sk.label: Secret Key *

version.help: Default API version used when the request does not specify one (e.g., 2024-03-01-preview).
version.label: API Version
version.note: Default: 2024-03-01-preview. This can be overridden by request query parameters.
version.warning_text: The model name should be your deployment name, not the original model name.

50.description: OpenAI compatible channel, supports custom Base URL

account.help: Your Cloudflare account ID for the AI gateway.
account.label: Account ID

auth_type.help: Choose how to authenticate to Coze: Personal Access Token or OAuth JWT.
auth_type.label: Authentication Type

jwt.help: JSON configuration for Coze OAuth JWT: client_type, client_id, coze_www_base, coze_api_base, private_key, public_key_id.
jwt.label: OAuth JWT Configuration *
jwt.placeholder:
OAuth JWT configuration in JSON format:
{{example}}
jwt.required: Required fields: client_type, client_id, coze_www_base, coze_api_base, private_key, public_key_id

user.help: Optional Coze user ID used for bot operations (if required by your setup).
user.label: User ID

api_key.help: Credentials for the selected provider. Stored encrypted. Leave empty on edit to keep existing.
api_key.label: API Key
api_key.note: Current API key is hidden for security. Enter a new key only if you want to update it.
api_key.placeholder_edit: Leave empty to keep existing key

base_url.help: Provider API endpoint (e.g., https://api.openai.com). Leave empty to use the default for the chosen provider.
base_url.label: Base URL (Optional)

name.help: Human-readable identifier. Use provider/environment in the name, for example "OpenAI GPT-4 Production".
name.label: Channel Name *

priority.help: Lower numbers are tried first when multiple channels support a model.
priority.label: Priority

type.help: Select the upstream provider. This determines models, auth method, and default Base URL.
type.label: Channel Type *

weight.help: Load balancing weight among channels with the same priority. Higher weight receives more requests.
weight.label: Weight

groups.help: Restrict access to specific user groups. Empty means all users can access. The default group is always kept.
groups.label: Groups *

inference_profile.help: JSON map of model name to AWS Bedrock Inference Profile ARN. Use to route certain models via specific Bedrock inference profiles.
inference_profile.label: Inference Profile ARN Map (AWS Bedrock)
inference_profile.note: Map model names to AWS Bedrock inference profile ARNs (optional)
inference_profile.placeholder:
AWS Bedrock inference profile ARN mapping:
{{example}}

model_configs.help: Unified per-model settings. Fields: ratio (input pricing multiplier), completion_ratio (output multiplier), max_tokens (limit).
model_configs.label: Model Configs (JSON)
model_configs.note: Configure pricing and limits per model (optional)
model_configs.select_type_notice: Select a channel type to configure Model Configs.

model_mapping.help: Map external/legacy model names to this provider's actual model names. JSON object: { "from": "to" }.
model_mapping.label: Model Mapping (JSON)
model_mapping.note: Map model names for this channel (optional)
model_mapping.placeholder:
Model name mapping in JSON format:
{{example}}

models.help: Models available through this channel. Leave empty to allow all provider models. Use the buttons to fill related/all models; duplicates are removed.
models.label: Supported Models *
models.select_type_notice: Select a channel type to configure Supported Models.

api_format.help: Select which upstream API surface should handle requests. ChatCompletion is the historical default; choose Response when the upstream expects OpenAI Response API payloads.
api_format.label: Upstream API Format *

base_url.help: Base URL of the OpenAI-compatible endpoint, e.g., https://api.your-provider.com. /v1 is appended automatically when required.
base_url.label: Base URL *

version.help: Select the API version for iFlytek Spark (e.g., v3.5).
version.label: Spark Version

system_prompt.help: Optional text prepended as a system message to every request sent through this channel. Use for guardrails or style. Clients can still override with their own system messages.
system_prompt.label: System Prompt
system_prompt.placeholder: Optional system prompt to prepend to all requests

errors.invalid_json_message: Fix tooling JSON before editing the whitelist.

tooling.fix_json_notice: Fix the tooling JSON above to manage the built-in tool whitelist.

tooling.label: Tooling Config (JSON)
tooling.note: Configure built-in tool allowlists and per-call pricing (optional)

whitelist.empty: No tools pinned. All built-in tools remain available.
whitelist.pricing_required: Set pricing to unblock "{{tool}}". Requests remain blocked until pricing is configured.

whitelist.title: Built-in Tool Whitelist

playground.system_prompt:
You are a helpful AI assistant with expertise across multiple domains including technical topics, creative tasks, and analytical reasoning.

## Context and Capabilities

Your responses should be grounded in your training data and adapted to the user's needs. When uncertain about current events or information beyond your training, acknowledge these limitations rather than speculate.

**You excel at:**
- Breaking down complex problems into clear, manageable steps
- Providing code examples with proper syntax highlighting and explanation
- Analyzing data and offering evidence-based insights
- Creative writing with attention to tone, style, and audience
- Teaching concepts through clear explanations and examples

**You cannot:**
- Access external URLs, browse the web, or retrieve real-time information
- Execute code, run commands, or interact with external systems
- Access files, databases, or personal data outside this conversation

## Response Guidelines

**Adapt your style to the task:**
- Technical questions → Precise, structured answers with code/examples
- Creative requests → Engaging, imaginative responses
- Analysis tasks → Evidence-based reasoning with clear conclusions
- Simple queries → Direct answers (offer elaboration if relevant)
- Complex problems → Step-by-step breakdowns with explanations

**Format for clarity:**
- Use Markdown for structure (headers, lists, code blocks, emphasis)
- Include code blocks with language tags for syntax highlighting
- Break long responses into logical sections
- Use tables, bullet points, and numbering for readability

**Engage authentically:**
- Ask clarifying questions when requirements are ambiguous
- Acknowledge uncertainty or limitations directly
- Offer alternative approaches when appropriate
- Vary language naturally (avoid repetitive phrasing)
- Show reasoning for complex or subjective topics

## Handling Sensitive Content

For potentially harmful, illegal, or sensitive topics:
- Provide factual, educational information where appropriate
- Explain risks, legal considerations, and ethical implications
- Redirect to constructive alternatives when requests could cause harm
- Decline requests that clearly promote illegal activities or harm

## Quality Standards

- **Accuracy**: Ground responses in knowledge, acknowledge gaps
- **Clarity**: Use precise language, define technical terms
- **Conciseness**: Match depth to question complexity
- **Helpfulness**: Anticipate follow-up needs, offer next steps
- **Respect**: Maintain professional, empathetic tone regardless of topic
playground.title: AI Playground

settings.description: Configure your account and system settings
settings.title: Settings

empty.none: No channels are configured in the system
empty.title: No Channels Found

search.placeholder: Search channels by name or status...

status.subtitle: Monitor the status and performance of all channels
status.title: Channel Status

descriptions.About: About page content (markdown/HTML supported by frontend rendering).
descriptions.ApproximateTokenEnabled: Use a faster approximation for token counting to improve performance (may be slightly less accurate).
descriptions.AutomaticDisableChannelEnabled: Automatically disable channels that show sustained failures.
descriptions.AutomaticEnableChannelEnabled: Automatically re‑enable previously disabled channels when healthy.
descriptions.ChannelDisableThreshold: Failure rate threshold (percentage) to auto‑disable a channel. Default 5%.
descriptions.ChatLink: External chat/support link shown in the UI.
descriptions.DisplayInCurrencyEnabled: Show usage and quotas as currency in the UI, based on the configured conversion.
descriptions.DisplayTokenStatEnabled: Display token statistics in logs and dashboards when available.
descriptions.EmailDomainRestrictionEnabled: Only allow registrations from domains listed below.
descriptions.EmailDomainWhitelist: Comma-separated allowed email domains (e.g., gmail.com, example.com).
descriptions.EmailVerificationEnabled: Require email verification for actions like registration or password reset.
descriptions.Footer: Footer text or HTML displayed site‑wide.
descriptions.GitHubClientId: GitHub OAuth Client ID used for login.
descriptions.GitHubClientSecret: GitHub OAuth Client Secret used to exchange authorization codes. Stored securely and never displayed.
descriptions.GitHubOAuthEnabled: Enable GitHub OAuth login. Requires GitHub Client ID and Secret.
descriptions.GroupRatio: JSON mapping of group‑specific billing ratios. Controls discounts/premiums by user group.
descriptions.HomePageContent: Content displayed on the home page.
descriptions.LarkClientId: Lark app ID for Lark OAuth login.
descriptions.LarkClientSecret: Lark app secret used for completing the OAuth flow. Stored securely and never displayed.
descriptions.LogConsumeEnabled: Record usage/consumption logs. Turn off to reduce storage overhead.
descriptions.Logo: Logo URL displayed in the header/login screens.
descriptions.MessagePusherAddress: Endpoint of the alert/notification pusher service for log events.
descriptions.MessagePusherToken: Authentication token for the alert/notification pusher. Stored securely and never displayed.
descriptions.Notice: Site‑wide announcement content shown to all users.
descriptions.OidcClientId: OIDC Client ID used when initiating the OIDC login flow.
descriptions.OidcClientSecret: OIDC client secret used during the token exchange. Stored securely and never displayed.
descriptions.OidcEnabled: Enable OpenID Connect (OIDC) login. Requires OIDC endpoints and credentials.
descriptions.PasswordLoginEnabled: Allow users to sign in with email and password. Disable to require OAuth or other providers.
descriptions.PasswordRegisterEnabled: Allow new users to register with email and password.
descriptions.PreConsumedQuota: Quota reserved at request start to avoid abuse. Unused part is returned after billing.
descriptions.QuotaForInvitee: Quota reward granted to the invitee upon successful registration.
descriptions.QuotaForInviter: Quota reward granted to the inviter after a successful invite.
descriptions.QuotaForNewUser: Initial quota granted to each newly registered user.
descriptions.QuotaPerUnit: Conversion ratio for currency display. Higher value makes each $ represent more quota.
descriptions.QuotaRemindThreshold: When remaining quota falls below this value, users will be reminded.
descriptions.RegisterEnabled: Master switch for user registration. Turn off to stop all new sign-ups.
descriptions.RetryTimes: Automatic retry attempts for upstream requests on transient errors.
descriptions.ServerAddress: Public base URL of this server (used in links/callbacks).
descriptions.SMTPAccount: SMTP username or account email used to authenticate.
descriptions.SMTPFrom: From address used in outgoing emails (e.g., no-reply@yourdomain).
descriptions.SMTPPort: SMTP server port (e.g., 587 for STARTTLS, 465 for SMTPS).
descriptions.SMTPServer: SMTP server hostname for sending emails.
descriptions.SMTPToken: SMTP password or application token used to authenticate. Stored securely and never displayed.
descriptions.SystemName: System display name shown in the UI and emails.
descriptions.TopUpLink: External link for users to purchase or top up quota.
descriptions.TurnstileCheckEnabled: Enable Cloudflare Turnstile on critical actions (registration/reset).
descriptions.TurnstileSecretKey: Cloudflare Turnstile secret key used by the server. Keep this confidential.
descriptions.TurnstileSiteKey: Cloudflare Turnstile site key used by the frontend.
descriptions.WeChatAccountQRCodeImageURL: URL of the WeChat account QR code image displayed to users.
descriptions.WeChatAuthEnabled: Enable WeChat login. Requires WeChat server settings.
descriptions.WeChatServerToken: Verification token for your WeChat server integration. Stored securely and never displayed.
